did.abstract: Ellen Ray and William Schaap were filmmakers, publishers, and authors who were best known for thier criticism of the CIA. The Ellen Ray and William Schaap Papers contain 40 reels of film and 1 1-inch video tape of Ellen Ray's film recordings, and one box of research materials and correspondence related to their films. The content of the reels relates primarily to the films Conspiracy and Grenada: Nobody's Backyard. Also included in the collection is a copy of the script for Grenada: Nobody's Backyard.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Karen Ranucci on behalf of Ellen Ray and William Schaap in 2016; additional materials were donated in 2017. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2017.004 and 2017.020.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this collection have not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ellen Ray and William Schaap were filmmakers, publishers, and authors who were best known for thier criticism of the CIA. Schapp and Ray were married for 44 years and collaborated frequently with oneanother. Schaap also wroked as an attorney and represented CIA whistleblowers, including Philip Agee. Ray was a journalist and documentary filmmaker, producing the film Stand Up Grenada, which documented the government of Maurice Bishop and attempts by the United States to destabilize him. She also co-authored the book Guantanamo: What the World Should Know, with attorney Michael Ratner in 2004. Together Ray and Schaap published the magazine, Covert Action Information Bulletin from 1978 to 2000, and co-authored the book Covertaction: The Roots of Terrorism in 2003.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Upon receipt of this collection, films received a basic preservation assessment which determined that the majority of films showed traces of mold. At that time, materials were inventoried and moved into quarantine. They have not been arranged by an archivist.
Additional materials added to the collection in 2017, were described at the collection-level at the time of accessioning and added as box 7.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Ellen Ray and William Schaap Papers contain 40 reels of film and 1 1-inch video tape of Ellen Ray's film recordings. The content of the reels relates primarily to the films Conspiracy and Grenada: Nobody's Backyard. Also included in the collection is a copy of the script for Grenada: Nobody's Backyard.

The collection also contains on box of correspondence and research materials related to Ray's and Schaap's films and the magazine CountersSpy. Research materials include photocopies of CIA documents related to the overthrow of Grenada president Maurice Bishop, dated 1981-1984, transcripts from legal cases, and reports on the Russian economy (2000-2001), narcotics enforcement, Cuba, and a variety of other topics.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
